summary: "The Brothers Karamazov" is the final novel by Russian writer Fyodor Dostoevsky. It was written over two years and published in a magazine from 1879 to 1880. The story is set in 19th-century Russia and explores big ideas like God, free will, and morality through the lives of the Karamazov brothers. It's considered one of the best books ever written, even though Dostoevsky died soon after it was published. The plot mainly focuses on the murder of their father, which raises questions about faith, doubt, and right and wrong.
title: The Brothers Karamazov
